See <http://betterwriting.net/projects/fed01/>

The following are data used in an analysis of _The Federalist_ papers by Alexander Hamilton and James Madison (published as series from 1787-1788).  The source of the texts was <http://lcweb2.loc.gov/const/fed/fedpaper.txt> 

The data were generated from the texts using tagging and visualization software, Docuscope. 

The first row is the variable names. The author of each paper is in 'Group' variable with 1=Hamilton, 2=Madison, 3=disputed authorship. See the top link for further explanation of the variables.

The dataset may be freely used and distributed for non-commercial purposes.

Jeff Collins <jeff.collins@acm.org> 31 Oct 2002

TextNumber	TextName	Group	FirstPerson	InnerThinking	ThinkPositive	ThinkNegative	ThinkingAhead	ThinkingBack	WordPicture	SpaceInterval	Motion	PastEvents	ShiftingEvts	TimeInterval	CueComKnow	CuePriorText	CueReader	CueNotifier	CueMovement	CueReasoning
1	Hfed_01.txt	1	0.68	3.5	2.71	3.16	2.09	0.28	1.69	0.4	0.34	0.96	0.23	0.51	2.48	4.4	1.58	6.21	0.06	0.85
6	Hfed_06.txt	1	0.08	1.63	1.67	3.42	0.46	0.38	1.63	0.42	0.21	1.25	0.25	0.83	1.79	4.09	1.17	4.88	0	0.71
7	Hfed_07.txt	1	0	2.17	1.98	2.36	1.49	0.69	1.1	0.19	0.04	1.37	0.27	0.5	1.29	5.06	0.76	5.79	0.04	0.69
